intro: Psatherips × fragilis, commonly known as the fragrant hybrid psatherips, is a rare and delicate plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to temperate regions and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges and shaded gardens due to its preference for partial shade. Due to its fragility, it requires careful cultivation and is prized for its ornamental value and subtle aromatic qualities.
